mods.abstract: Female adult, 50cm, Venezuelan rag doll, woven stuffed fabric body, embroidered features, blue underwear, golden polka dotted green dirndl skirt, yellow printed cotton blouse with yellow felt collar, beige felt hair covering, gold string necklace, green and red felt arm-bands, handmade. Accompanying information describes as Venezuelan doll, 1985. The doll was hand-made by Mrs. Llorens's mother Mrs. Efigenia Lovera in Caracas and donated to Hill Memorial Library 1985. there is a letter from Mrs. Lloren, it reads the following: 'Dear ladies and gentlemen: I am sending you a hand-made doll. She is from Venezuela. She was hand-made by my mother Mrs. Efigenia Lovera in Caracas 1985. I am a graduate student from LSU. I always liked and admired the doll collection that is exhibited in the Library Building--Baton Rouge. I talked my mother into making a doll similar to the one she used to play with around the 30s, now we want to donate the doll.'
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
